title: Attention U-Net as a surrogate model for groundwater prediction
abstract: This study proposes a physics-based convolutional encoder-decoder neural network (Attention U-Net) as a surrogate model to quickly calculate the response of the groundwater system. The model accurately predicts the steady state response of a highly heterogeneous groundwater system given the locations and piezometric head of up to 3 wells as input.

title: A Hybrid DSCNN-GRU Based Surrogate Model for Transient Groundwater Flow Prediction
abstract: The method combines a depth separable convolutional neural network (DSCNN) with the GRU framework to construct an efficient surrogate model specifically for predicting groundwater flow.

title: Convolutional long short-term memory neural network for groundwater change prediction
authors: Mounir K. B. G. D. Aziz
abstract: A spatio-temporal groundwater deep learning model is proposed for monthly groundwater prediction using Convolutional Long Short-Term Memory (CLSTM) Neural Network. The combination of CNN and LSTM captures spatial features and temporal dependencies for groundwater simulations.

title: Deep learning emulators for groundwater contaminant transport modelling
abstract: This paper presents deep learning emulators based on multi-layer perceptrons (MLPs) and recurrent neural networks (RNNs) to efficiently model groundwater contaminant transport. The emulators predict contaminant concentration at specific locations and breakthrough curves.

title: A deep-learning-based surrogate model for data assimilation in dynamic subsurface flow problems
abstract: This surrogate model consists of 3D convolutional and recurrent (convLSTM) neural networks, designed to capture the spatial-temporal information associated with dynamic subsurface flow systems for data assimilation.

title: A U-Net architecture as a surrogate model combined with a geostatistical spectral algorithm for transient groundwater flow inverse problems
abstract: This study proposes a U-Net architecture as a surrogate model combined with a geostatistical spectral algorithm for transient groundwater flow inverse problems, reducing runtime and enabling fast quantification of uncertainties.

title: Multi-scale Digital Twin: Developing a fast and physics-informed surrogate model for groundwater contamination with uncertain climate models
authors: E. A. B. F. von Stackelberg
abstract: A physics-informed machine learning surrogate model using U-Net enhanced Fourier Neural Operator (U-FNO) to solve PDEs of groundwater flow and transport simulations, capable of predicting spatiotemporal variations under uncertain climate conditions.

title: Accelerating regional-scale groundwater flow simulations with a hybrid deep neural network model incorporating mixed input types: A case study of the northeast Qatar aquifer
abstract: A 'Dual Path CNN-MLP' architecture for mixed input data types is proposed for regional groundwater flow modeling, with demonstrated alignment with MODFLOW outcomes for the northeast Qatar aquifer.

title: Review of machine learning-based surrogate models of groundwater contaminant modeling
abstract: This paper reviews 120 research articles on machine learning-based surrogate models for groundwater contaminant modeling published between 1994 and 2022, outlining the state of the art methods and identifying significant research directions.

title: Groundwater contamination source identification and high-dimensional parameter inversion using residual dense convolutional neural network
abstract: A deep learning method based on residual dense-connected convolutional neural network (RDCNN) is proposed to construct surrogate model for groundwater flow and solute transport models with multiple time-varying contaminant sources.

title: Deep surrogate model of groundwater and salt dynamics for optimizing subsurface pipes layout in irrigation areas
abstract: A U-Net-based deep learning model is constructed to predict long-term equilibrium responses under different drainage layouts, focusing on steady-state groundwater levels, salinity distributions, and cumulative drainage volume.

title: Integrating analytical solutions and U-Net model for predicting groundwater contaminant plumes in pump-and-treat systems
abstract: Integration of analytical solutions and U-Net model enables leveraging both deep learning capabilities and classical physics-based groundwater theories for enhanced prediction accuracy and computational efficiency.

title: GeoFUSE: A High-Efficiency Surrogate Model for Seawater Intrusion Prediction and Uncertainty Reduction
abstract: GeoFUSE is a novel deep-learning-based surrogate framework that integrates the U-Net Fourier Neural Operator (U-FNO) with Principal Component Analysis (PCA) and Ensemble Smoother with Multiple Data Assimilation (ESMDA) for seawater intrusion prediction.

title: Machine learning surrogates for efficient hydrologic modeling: Insights from stochastic simulations of managed aquifer recharge
abstract: This study assesses a hybrid modeling workflow using process-based models combined with ML surrogate models (including deep CNNs, RNNs, vision transformers, and networks with Fourier transforms) for simulations of variably saturated groundwater flow.

title: Surrogate modeling for porous flow using deep neural networks
abstract: Proposes a deep-learning-based reduced-order modeling (ROM) framework for groundwater flow simulation achieving significant speed increase for two-dimensional systems compared with full-order simulation.
